item.title: Legalizing drugs and consequences?
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

Some benefits of legalizing drugs are:

A more pure product. If drugs were sold and regulated by the government, you wouldn’t have all these impurities and shitty quality drugs produced on the black market. This could reduce many potential health problems.

There would also be no need for drug gangs such as the columbian cartel. These gangs just would not exist if there was no black market for drugs.

Also, prisons are really over crowded. Murderers and rapists are released early to make room for non-violent drug offenders. What about those people that smoke marijuana so that they do not have to live in constant pain and suffering due to whatever illness they might have. Do they deserve to be locked up in jail?

US tax payers pay over 19 billion dollars a year on the drug war. The drug war has not been proven to be effective, and it can never be won. This is a lot of wasted money that could be spent on better things.
